amazon_product.title: Motorola Moto G (3rd Generation) No Contract Phone (Virgin Mobile) - Retail Packaging
amazon_product.description: Amazon.com: Motorola Moto G (3rd Generation) No Contract Phone (Virgin Mobile) - Retail Packaging: Cell Phones & Accessories

reviews.description: Excellent phone, nice camera, speedy with the functions , probably the best phone I've had in years.
reviews.title: Great phone

reviews.description: I've had the phone for about 6 months. It has a generally good battery life, is waterproof, and responsive. I recommend getting an SD card with it, however, since the 8gb internal drive is very limited.
reviews.title: It has a generally good battery life

reviews.description: Phone is very slow! Memory sucks as expected. Speakers are loud and battery life is decent. Lack of customization. Phone is horrible in my opinion I couldn't stand it. The phone does have a nice strong build though, and the waterproof feature is cool. Overall the cons outweigh the pros so I gave it a friend and went back to my HTC 816. I would personally pass on this phone!
reviews.title: Not so good!

reviews.description: So Virgin Mobile has literally ruined my life for the last two weeks- I bought a new device and wanted it on my current phone number. Virgin Mobile instead gave me a Sprint Business phone number in random area code without my knowledge. After realizing thier mistake I called them and they told me they could do nothing because it was Sprint's problem. I called Sprint- they also can do nothing because my name is not on the account. They cannot cancel without the name, nor can they tell me who's name it is. Everyday at work, for two weeks, on my lunch, for an hour, I would call various departments, all who would redirect me because they can do nothing. 2 weeks later, I get someone who says they will move my new device onto my old phone plan. Instead, they move my old broken phone and number onto my new phone plan which I had stopped paying for... Because THAT makes more sense. Let's move a broken phone onto an unpaid plan, instead of a new phone onto a paid plan. I called back, they then say they moved the new device and the old number onto the unpaid plan. They then suggest that I pay them again, and the new phone will have my correct number. I do so. Now neither phones have service, and I am out $$. 10hrs+ over 2 weeks time and no solutions? Good job guys, no one should buy from you ever again.
reviews.title: Worst Customer Service On The Planet
